Package mgci.jhdap.shogi

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Bishop
    A Class representing a bishop in a game of shogi.
    BoardPanel
    The JPanel for the shogi board.
    Command
    This abstract class is meant to be used to deal with many different inputed text commands by using polymorphism.
    CommandLineInterface
    An experimental command line interface.
    EmptyPiece
    A class representing a tile on which there is no piece.
    GameState
    A class representing the state of the game at any given moment.
    GoldGeneral
    A Class representing a gold general in a game of shogi.
    GraphicUI
    The JFrame containing all of the various JComponents that make up the shogi GUI.
    King
    A Class representing a king in a game of shogi.
    Knight
    A Class representing a knight in a game of shogi.
    Lance
    A Class representing a lance in a game of shogi.
    Move
    A class that represents a piece move.
    Pawn
    A Class representing a pawn in a game of shogi.
    Piece
    A Class representing a piece in a game of shogi.
    PlayerPane
    This class represents the info box of one player in the statistics panel present in the shogi GUI.
    PromotablePiece
    An abstract class representing a piece that can promote.
    PromotedBishop
    A Class representing a promoted bishop in a game of shogi.
    PromotedKnight
    A Class representing a promoted knight in a game of shogi.
    PromotedLance
    A Class representing a promoted lance in a game of shogi.
    PromotedPawn
    A Class representing a promoted pawn in a game of shogi.
    PromotedRook
    A Class representing a promoting rook in a game of shogi.
    PromotedSilverGeneral
    A Class representing a promoted silver general in a game of shogi.
    Rook
    A Class representing a rook in a game of shogi.
    Shogi
    This class is the launcher for the entire program.
    ShogiConsole
    Experimental debug console for shogi GUI.
    SilverGeneral
    A Class representing a silver general in a game of shogi.
    SoundEffect
    A class that represents a sound effect.
    StatsPanel
    The JPanel containing all of the statistics for the shogi GUI, including the move history, and the PlayerPanes with the timers and player names.
    TextUI
    A class used for playing shogi in a text user interface.
    Tile
    This class represents the position of a tile or shogi board square.
    UnpromotablePiece
    An abstract class representing a piece that cannot promote.
